result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher A. Malzhan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any other sentence currently being served.

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all earnings received in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any other sentence currently being served.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: and Order - ERP
from DOC requesting remaining confinement time be converted to extended supervision - DE has completed the ERP
of Sentencing Hearing - June 24, 2016
Information for Defendants After Felony Conviction - Warning not to Possess Firearms

Case called @ 2:27 p.m. Christopher A. Malzhan in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Defendant Christopher A. Malzhan in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have received/reviewed the revocation packet. No corrections or clarifications to be noted. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Johnson. Statement by DE. Court orders: 6 year term of imprisonment - Bifurcated SEH - 21 mos IC/51 mos ES - Concurrent to any other sentence currently being served - 134 days CFTS. ES Conditions: The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, AODA and follow through, DNA sample and surcharge, Costs w/ 60 DTP, $200 Drug Buy Reimbursement request, Costs to be paid from up to 25% of inmate earnings during IC. Defendant is eligible for CIP or SAP.  Appeal rights given.
from Atty Johnson with attached photos
Sentencing hearing on June 24, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

1:30 pm case called. Defendant Christopher A. Malzhan in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Defendant Christopher A. Malzhan in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached-joint recommendation for PSI to be completed. Preliminary hearing discussed. Defendant wishes to waive the right to a preliminary hearing. Court questions the defendant and accepts waiver of right to preliminary hearing. Court has read the complaint, finds probable cause, and enters an order binding the defendant for trial. Information filed. Attorney Johnson confirms receipt, waives formal reading and enters No Contest plea. Court questions defendant-confirms plea.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest. Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Court orders a PSI-matter set for sentencing on June 24, 2016 at 2:15 pm. (Changed on the record due to time needed for hearing). Attorney Johnson addresses medical appointments of defendant. Court states defendant will need to make arrangements with the jail and any further issues can be addressed in the aftermath.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum

Plea hearing on April 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on June 24, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court, appearing via telephone.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Johnson:  Spoke with Federal counsel last week - its expected that he will return to Waushara Co once sentenced.  Counsel anticipate entering a plea with PSI request and argued terms at SEH.  Atty Johnson to inquire with Federal counsel that the PSI be released to the State's authorities in anticipation of the plea being entered.  Court would also send a written request.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 8:45 AM: Defendant Christopher A. Malzhan in court with attorney Erik Johnson.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of 10 day time limits for preliminary hearing.   Per DA:  Federal SEH to occur this week and also Green Lake concerns.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Atty Johnson will keep the State advised of Def's whereabouts after SEH on 2/26/2016.  Status conference scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 09:05 am.

Initial appearance at 02-19-2016 11:45 am

Defendant is prohibited from leaving the State of Wisconsin.   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant and Atty Szilagyi appear via video from the WC Jail.

Case called @ 1:17 p.m. Defendant Christopher A. Malzhan in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD.  DA Blader requesting $20,000 Cash Bond. DA Blader notes that there is a correction that will need to be made to the complaint and an amended complaint is forthcoming. Statement by Atty Szilagyi regarding bond - requesting lower cash bond. Court orders $25000 Cash Bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 11:45 am.
